questions.text: What was the name of the city that was first shown in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Kandor City.

	The show opened with a voice over explaining that this was the story of the House of El. Turns out the voice over was that of Superman's grandfather, who would be the main character in the series. As the voice over continued the words "Kandor City" popped on the screen and we saw a young Seg-El for the first time.

questions.text: How long before Superman (Kal-El) was born was the opening scene of the series set?
questions.explanation:
200 years.

	As heard in the opening voice over, Seg-El, was nearly the last of the House of El. The series started with the story of how he survived his own grandfather's trial for treason.

questions.text: During a scene set in a bar, 14 years after the opening scene, a man was wearing a hat that appeared to have the logo of the Detroit Tigers on it. What sport do the Tigers play?
questions.explanation:
Baseball.

	To help ease with the difficulty of the question, only baseball is a real sport. The scene is set in a bar where Seg-El is fighting with government officials. After the fight, the man is shown lurking at the corner of the edge of the bar. He was wearing the hat as Seg-El ran from the bar.  Later in the episode it was revealed that it was a Detroit Tigers hat, and the man wearing it was from Earth.

questions.text: What was the name of the terrorist organization fighting against the government?
questions.explanation:
Black Zero.

	Black Zero was trying to blow up the chamber that included the Voice of Rao. Seg-El saved them from the bomber, and in doing so earned the right to get his "rank" back within society. His new name would be Seg-El and he'd be joining the scientist's rank.

questions.text: Who played Seg-El in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Cameron Cuffe.

	It was the major credit for the actor. He played Superman's grandfather in the series set on his home planet. Sipos and Cowan also had roles on the series. Adam Strange was a character on the show.

questions.text: Kryptonians delivered their children the same way as humans on Earth.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was mentioned how "weird" it was that they used to carry their babies in the womb. It was said how inefficient that was. Babies were made by taking the genetic materials of the parents and blending them in a machine.

questions.text: Despite being betrothed to another, who was it that Seg-El chose to date?
questions.explanation:
Lyta-Zod.

	It was Nyssa-Vex who he was promised to after his heroic efforts to save the government leaders. Despite that, and it being his ticket back into society, he chose to continue dating Lyta-Zod.  Lyta was played by Georgina Campbell.

questions.text: The Fortress of Solitude was in the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Charys-El, Seg's mother, showed him the Fortress of Solitude, after Adam Strange showed up on the planet and gave him the key to get into the hidden place. Charys said she kept it a secret for many years because without the key she didn't know how get into the secret laboratory.

questions.text: What is the evil plan that Adam Strange was trying to stop from being set in motion?
questions.correct: Changing of history to stop Kal-El from being born.
options: Electing Brainiac as the leader of Krypton.
questions.explanation:
Changing of history to stop Kal-El from being born.

	Adam Strange travelled through time and space to get to Krypton and warn Seg-El about the plot to change time and stop Kal-El from being born. This was to stop Kal from becoming Superman. Adam was played by Shaun Sipos.

False.

	Despite being mentioned in the opening monologue, and in several other instances, he didn't appear in the episode. While Adam Strange time traveled to get to Krypton, Superman himself did not. The series was set more than 175 years before Kal-El (Superman) was born.
